revised_title: Ancient Astronomy and Calendrical Systems in Literate Societies
tldr: This article discusses the place of astronomy in ancient civilizations, focusing on contributions to the understanding of ancient calendrical systems and lunar observations. The authors explore the use of sundials and other instruments in measuring time and the accuracy of Babylonian timekeeping. They also analyze a specific British Museum tablet that provides valuable information on lunar observations and the design of Babylonian clepsydras.
